reviews.review_msg: Dr. Healey was great for Contemporary Crim Theory. He was very honest in what he expected of students and also displayed that he's willing to work with you if you don't understand. He was very straight forward in what was going to be on exams, even giving us the questions days beforehand. Really enjoyed his class!

I've had Jay twice now, for Sexual Offences and Offenders and Contemporary Crim Theory. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about the material he lectures on. He encourages discussion and participation so it's good to be engaged and having the readings done is a must. He keeps things interesting and has a good sense of humor. Definitely recommd
There are iclicker quizzes so you have to keep up with the readings. Jay made lecture really enjoyable though, he always kept it interesting & involved the class in discussions.
Great guy overall, I had him in first year and he really made me want to show up for class, study for his class and you'll get a good grade
Great class. Super informative & enthusiastic about the course and about teaching. Absolutely loved the class. A little unclear with test topics sometimes.
Jay is a really nice person and his lectures are interesting. He asks the class questions and keeps us engaged. Would recommend.
Hilarious prof who puts things in perspective. His classes are fun and helpful. Tests are pretty easy and NON CUMULATIVE.
Nice guy
Really good instructor! I enjoyed this class thoroughly. He is very passionate about criminology and always made an 8.30 class interesting! Fair expectations, fair marking, easy-going!

Very good prof! Not a crim major and did perfectly fine in his class because he keeps it interesting. Must know the textbook inside and out for exams and iclicker questions in class. Test are mainly multiple choice and for written you have to be very detailed and specific to get the full marks! He makes you feel good about going to school :)

An interesting person with a definite knack for teaching at a university level. He is able to control the class really well, and explained things pretty clearly. Read the textbook really well for the exam.

Jay is a very enjoyable guy to take a class with. Lectures were always very interesting to go to, lots of fun stories told. Textbook is mandatory, you need to read the chapter (or 2) before class, not a heavy workload. Quiz during class to check if you actually read, and midterms are very fair, everything related to slides. All in all, very nice!

Jay is an enjoyable person, very entertaining and relates the course material by telling us personal stories as well as asking the class. He definitely kept the 3 hour lecture interesting (hey, he never even kept us the full 3 hours). First midterm was a breeze, since we did so well, he challenged us on the second.. hard. Fair exams. Good class.

Very entertaining prof, always kept the class lively and fun! I personally loved this class and the prof was great, would definitely take another class with him at SFU. Midterms are both quite easy. Keep up with readings, class is all textbook based. I'd recommend this class for sure.

need the textbook, entire class is based on empirical evidence and theories.  This prof loves to see empirical evidence in exams and essays. he marks hard. writing intensive. he likes to see main concepts from theories combined with your critical thinking with empirical evidence to support or refute arguments made.

Awesome guy! Always kept class interesting with his charisma, and constantly engaged students in discussion during lectures. Really approachable with students' questions and concerns. Would definitely recommend for people to take a class with him.

Such a great sessional prof. He really was interested in the topic, his exams (2 MTs and 1 Final) were all multiple choice. make sure you read the articles laid out in the study guide. Exams are def based on them & his lectures. attend class! he's very funny and charismatic. I'd take him again.

One of the best prof's I've ever had! Approachable, makes sure that life is easy for the students, interactive in class, knows his material and is passionate about it. After the first class he made weekly notes as requested by students so we could interact more. Would recommend for any class just because of his attitude about teaching.

What a waste of time and money. Jay is not a very good professor and has an ego like he is King which is really irritating. Goes through material way too fast and thinks we already know the material. Exams are all multiple choice but don't be deceived they are hard! Do not take a course with him he goes off on tangets that are irrelevant to course.

While doing evaluations, Quote: "Folks, I know I'm disorganized." Funny.. if you knew, why did you never finish a lecture? And fyi, changing our midterm date without our permission is against school policy, especially the week before. Never take a class with this guy.

One word: AWESOME! He gets his students and can relate to them. Doesn't expect you know what he doesn't teach which is a plus, always willing to help you out even if he has to go out of his way, there needs to be more professors like him! Ignore the comments above, of course you will do bad if you don't put the effort in and jay tells you that.

Horrible, horrible and horrible. He never actually finishes a lecture, just goes off on his own tangents. Yes, he likes class participation, but I think he needs to be reasonable. We aren't going to have something to say on every single slide like he expects. Midterm was hard, even for a take home, and he changed this the week before. Horrible.

i dont know where to begin. first his midterm was take home, but the wording and question format were horrible ... went against the proper questioning techniques he himself taught. second, he never finishes his lectures, lack of powerpoint and notes, often gets distracted, and the list goes on. dont take this course with him
No Comments
